title: Crystal Cavern Nexus Adventure #66
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Luminous Crystal Chamber
rooms.description: A vast underground chamber filled with glowing crystals of every color. Blue and purple crystals pulse with inner light, casting dancing shadows on the rough stone walls. The air hums with energy. Stalactites drip from the ceiling, and a shallow pool of crystal-clear water reflects the ethereal glow. Ancient mining equipment lies scattered about.

items.name: old mining cart
items.description: A rusty metal cart filled with rocks and debris

items.name: geologist's field journal
items.description: A worn leather journal with notes about the cavern
items.text: Day 47: The crystal formations here are extraordinary! The main nexus crystal resonates at exactly 432 Hz. Dr. Sarah Chen discovered that the three primary crystal types - Azurite, Luminite, and Quartzite - form the foundation of this cave system. The sealed chamber beyond requires knowledge of these crystals.

items.name: metal tool chest
items.description: A heavy chest with three compartments for mining tools

items.name: hand drawn cave map
items.description: A detailed map showing the cavern system and crystal locations
items.text: Map notation: The Nexus Core lies beyond the Resonance Gallery. Three crystal types mark the path: Azurite (blue), Luminite (purple), and Quartzite (clear). The storage locker combination is the resonance frequency of the main crystal.

items.name: tarnished brass key
items.description: A small brass key with crystal dust coating it

items.name: sealed storage locker
items.description: A metal locker with a crystal-shaped lock

items.name: research documentation
items.description: Scientific notes about the cavern exploration
items.text: Research Team Notes: Lead researcher Dr. Sarah Chen has documented the three crystal types. The blue crystals are Azurite, found in the northern passages. The purple crystals are Luminite, discovered in the western chambers. The clear crystals are Quartzite, located throughout. Team members: Dr. Chen, geologist Marcus Webb, and engineer Lisa Torres.

items.name: reflective crystal pool
items.description: A shallow pool of water surrounded by glowing crystals

items.name: waterproof equipment pouch
items.description: A sealed pouch containing expedition supplies

items.name: heavy duty flashlight
items.description: A powerful flashlight for exploring dark passages

items.name: narrow eastern passage
items.description: A tight passage leading deeper into the cavern system, blocked by fallen rocks

rooms.name: Resonance Gallery
rooms.description: A magnificent gallery where massive crystals grow from floor to ceiling. The crystals emit a low humming sound that resonates through your bones. Three enormous crystal formations dominate the space - one blue, one purple, and one clear. Each has a plaque at its base. A reinforced door stands at the far end, covered in crystalline patterns.

items.name: massive blue crystal formation
items.description: A towering formation of deep blue crystals
items.text: Plaque: AZURITE FORMATION - Discovered 2019. This rare blue crystal exhibits piezoelectric properties and resonates with sound frequencies.

items.name: massive purple crystal formation
items.description: A stunning cluster of purple crystals that pulse with light
items.text: Plaque: LUMINITE FORMATION - Discovered 2020. These bioluminescent crystals generate their own light through unknown mechanisms.

items.name: massive clear crystal formation
items.description: A transparent crystal structure that refracts light into rainbows
items.text: Plaque: QUARTZITE FORMATION - Discovered 2021. The most common crystal type in this cavern system, known for its clarity and strength.

items.name: wooden observation platform
items.description: A raised platform with scientific equipment and notes

items.name: expedition team roster
items.description: A laminated document listing the research team
items.text: Crystal Cavern Research Expedition - Team Leader: Dr. Sarah Chen (Geologist). Team Members: Marcus Webb (Field Geologist), Lisa Torres (Mining Engineer). Mission: Document and study the unique crystal formations of the Nexus Cavern system.

items.name: scientific equipment crate
items.description: A large crate containing various instruments and tools

items.name: digital frequency meter
items.description: A device for measuring crystal resonance frequencies

items.name: reinforced exit door
items.description: A heavy steel door with a security panel. Three questions are displayed on a digital screen.

password_questions.question: Who leads this expedition?
password_questions.hint: Check the research notes and team roster

password_questions.question: What is the blue crystal called?
password_questions.hint: Read the plaques on the crystal formations

password_questions.question: What is the clear crystal called?
password_questions.hint: Examine all three crystal formation plaques

rooms.name: Crystal Nexus Core
rooms.description: You have reached the heart of the crystal cavern! An enormous central crystal pulses with brilliant white light, illuminating a natural cathedral of stone and crystal. The walls are covered in smaller crystals that reflect and amplify the light into a dazzling display. A natural chimney leads upward toward the surface, with carved steps spiraling up the walls. Fresh air flows down from above.

items.name: central nexus crystal
items.description: A massive crystal formation that serves as the heart of the entire cavern system, pulsing with energy

items.name: abandoned research station
items.description: A small camp with equipment, notes, and supplies left by the research team

items.name: final expedition log
items.description: The last entry in the expedition records
items.text: Final Log - Dr. Sarah Chen: We've done it! We've reached the Nexus Core. The central crystal is beyond anything we imagined. Its energy readings are off the charts. We're heading back to the surface to report our findings. The carved steps lead directly up and out. This discovery will change everything we know about crystalline formations.

rooms.win_message: You have successfully navigated the Crystal Cavern Nexus and reached the legendary Nexus Core! The massive central crystal pulses with approval as you climb the carved steps toward the surface. Sunlight streams down from above, and you emerge victorious from the depths, having solved all the puzzles and discovered the secrets of the crystal cavern. You win!
